intro: Hybanthus scariosus, commonly known as the scarious hybanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
